title: Black Jews for Black Lives: Shabbat Gathering with Kol Or
location: Union Park, 1501 W Randolph St, Chicago, IL 60606
notes: EVENT UPDATE:In hearing from our partners in the Right to Recovery coalition, and in seeing the shifts happening with who is leading and how Saturday’s protest is being planned, we are changing our Black Jews for Black Lives gathering to Friday, June 5 at 5:30 pm in Union Park to align with BLM Chicago’s Defund CPD: Fund Black Lives march.We will meet at 5:30 just south of the tennis courts in Union Park, along Washington Blvd. We will gather (as socially distanced as folks feel comfortable), sing (with masks on), hear testimony from members of Kol Or, and join the march together at 6:00 pm.The JCUA program will be from 5:45-6:15 and then weUnion Park is off the Ashland bus and the Ashland Green and Pink Line stop. We recommend if you are driving to park a few blocks away so your car is able to get out once the march starts.We will be live-streaming the event on the JCUA Facebook.At this time we will have a contingent but we are not part of organizing the larger event. Recommendations: wear your mask, bring water. Leave your vehicle outside the perimeter of the park because we don’t know if the park will be closed off following the event.EVENT DESCRIPTION:Join us this Friday for a “Black Jews for Black Lives Shabbat Gathering” led by JCUA’s Kol Or caucus for Jews of Color, taking place at in Union Park before the BLM Chicago’s Defund CPD: Fund Black Lives march. There will be song, prayer, and reflection. Black Jews need your allyship and support as we seek justice for George Floyd and dismantle white supremacy and defund the police. We will then join the march together. If your Shabbat practice allows, we’re calling on you to join us.SAFETY PLAN:We hope Saturday will be a peaceful, grounding morning. We will have marshalls clearly designated with orange vests carrying backpacks of supplies, and individuals prepared to be de-escalators and on cop watch. If you need assistance at all during the morning, please reach out to a marshall or someone on JCUA staff.For those who are able to come out, see ya there! For those who are not, we still see you ♥RSVP form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe0LzlpYiShq8JMwWbxyexX1Ids-yyDPaQWhG1th4vuEXecrw/viewform?usp=sf_link.Here is the Facebook event for Friday’s Action: https://www.facebook.com/events/303528150668758/Read our joint-statement by Kol Or and our White Working Group here: https://medium.com/jewish-council-on-urban-affairs/joint-statement-from-jcuas-white-racial-justice-working-group-and-kol-or-caucus-for-jews-of-color-e5c5d51cf4e4

title: Say Her Name: Breonna Taylor
location: The Riviera Theatre, 4746 N Racine Ave, Chicago, Illinois 60640
notes: June 5th 2020, Breonna Taylor would’ve turned 26.Breonna Taylor was a exceptional EMT worker, her job was to show up and make sure people were taken care of, so why haven’t we done the same for her? This day is going to be to collectively mourn, support, and celebrate Breonna Taylor. Her and black womxn everywhere.Far too often, Black Womxn are the ones leading these movements for change, demanding justice and equality, but are easily forgotten when it’s time for us to be represented.Too often, black womxn are loved in the shadows instead of outloud. Too many times, we are seen as the blueprint for culture, movements, humanity itself, and yet, we are not respected. We are discarded and forgotten and our cries are ignored. This narrative needs to change. We deserve to be seen, heard and loved, consistently & unconditionallyPlease note; We’re peacefully protesting and not enticing violence during this march. We will be LOUD! We will be giving Breonna the attention she deserves on her birthday!! We will be demanding justice for her and to bring her killers to jail!!Along with our being peaceful, we will also use this time to act. As a collective, there are several ways to bring Breonna justice. We will participate in doing that this & every day for the black womxn we see around us, know & love.—We will be organizing at the circular art piece next to The Riviera at 1:30PM and making our way down @ 2PM~ Please be sure to walk with a buddy and keep a mask on you face too!We will have volunteers passing out snacks, hand sanitizer, water and other supplies too.If you want to volunteer to assist as liaison for when we turn street/corners or supply providers, please contact host via DM

title: Walk To Recognize Racism
notes: Dear Community Leaders and Friends,Thank you all for joining a WALK TO RECOGNIZE RACISM, a peaceful march for our NW Chicago and Neighboring communities. Our journey begins at 10am, Saturday morning at Edgebrook Elementary School and will end at Wildwood Elementary School. At our arrival there will be a moment of reflection and music.This is a chance for us to begin the process and do the work. All families are welcome. Our goal is to end the divide and stand as a community.All of our neighboring communities are welcome to peacefully stand up against racism, please extend our heartfelt invitation.

title: Lincoln Square is Standing with Black Lives Matter-Safe Protest
location: Lincoln Ave and Sunnyside, Lincoln Square, Chicago, IL
notes: Have you wanted to be part of the upwelling of righteous protest against police brutality and senseless racist killing that has been happening across the city and the country, but didn’t want to risk your health or safety? This is your chance to do that: a quiet, socially-distanced display of our concern and anguish and our demand for change, happening here in our own neighborhood.We…1)Stand in solidarity with Black Lives Matters2)Demand justice for George Floyd, Breanna Taylor, and Ahmaud Arbery & all other victims.3)Demand a stop to police attacks on protesters4)Immediate accountability for the officers involved in the attack on two Black women in the Brickyard Mall on May 31st.Starting at the SW corner of Lincoln Ave and Sunnyside (across the street from Gideon Welles), protesters will social distance 6 – 10’ apart with the goal to ring Welles Park facing the street with our signs (preferably with messages on both sides). We don’t plan on chanting as that raises the risk for spreading Covid. A silent protest is powerful. We do not plan to march.For those who are higher risk for Covid or are concerned about being around too many people, we encourage a car caravan around the park as well.All participants must wear masks and social distance. This is a peaceful action. We would love for families to attend and show their support. We do not support any violence or property destruction!

title: Press Conference and Front-line Worker Speak Out
location: Dirksen Federal Building, 219 S Dearborn St, Chicago, Illinois 60604
notes: We will be holding a (socially distanced) press conference and public speak-out at the Dirksen Federal Building, noon on Monday, June 8, 2020.Workers will be announcing legal charges against the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) for breaking worker’s First Amendment rights to freedom of speech. CTA management illegally broke up workers meetings discussing the safety and ethics of driving “police shuttles” which are being used to transport police and National Guard to demonstrations opposing the racist police murder of George Floyd.Please join us to defend workers’ rights to freedom of speech and right to oppose police murder. Front-line workers, such as nurses, grocery, big box, postal and delivery workers are especially welcome to speak out with us.
